org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.common.crypto

Interface CryptoManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCryptoManager

    public interface CryptoManager
    Base interface for CryptoManager containing common methods for both ETSI ITS and IEEE standards.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] digest(byte[] message, AlgorithmIndicator alg)
      Method to generate a digest of a message using the given hash algorithm scheme.
      void disconnect()
      Method signaling to underlying components to release resources.
      java.security.KeyPair generateKeyPair(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
      Method to generate a new key pair for the given public key algorithm scheme.
      javax.crypto.SecretKey generateSecretKey(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
      Method to generate a new symmetric secret key for the given algorithm scheme.
      void setupAndConnect(CryptoManagerParams params)
      Method that needs to be called before any calls to the crypto manager is performed, it should initialize all underlying components with the supplied paramteters.

    • Method Detail

      • setupAndConnect

        void setupAndConnect(CryptoManagerParams params)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                     java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     BadCredentialsException,
                     java.security.SignatureException
        Method that needs to be called before any calls to the crypto manager is performed, it should initialize all underlying components with the supplied paramteters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters contained invalid data.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if required underlying cryptographic algorithms doesn't exist in JVM.
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException - if required cryptographic providers couldn't be found in JVM.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        BadCredentialsException - if supplied credentials wasn't successful when authentication towards underlying hardware.
        java.security.SignatureException - If internal problems occurred initializing the cryptomanager.

      • generateKeyPair

        java.security.KeyPair generateKeyPair(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Method to generate a new key pair for the given public key algorithm scheme.
        Parameters:
        alg - the type of key to generate
        Returns:
        a new key pair.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if other non-IO related problems occurred generating the key.

      • generateSecretKey

        javax.crypto.SecretKey generateSecretKey(AlgorithmIndicator alg)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                         java.io.IOException,
                                         java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Method to generate a new symmetric secret key for the given algorithm scheme.
        Parameters:
        alg - the type of key to generate
        Returns:
        a new secret key pair.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if other non-IO related problems occurred generating the key.

      • digest

        byte[] digest(byte[] message,
              AlgorithmIndicator alg)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method to generate a digest of a message using the given hash algorithm scheme.
        Parameters:
        message - the message data to generate a digest from.
        alg - the related hash algorithm scheme to use.
        Returns:
        a digest of the message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an unsupported public key algorithm scheme was given.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if related cryptographic algorithm wasn't available in JVM.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Method signaling to underlying components to release resources.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
